reviews.review_msg: Great professor. Caring and flexible. intriguing lectures that relate to real world problems to make it more more engaging.
Nick is an amazing professor. He is very engaging and passionate about human geography. I genuinely found this class interesting as it touched on many global topics. This class was a GPA booster.
Nick is a very passionate guy. Should read lecture summaries and look at quizzes for midterm/final

Amazing prof that cares! Little homework and some pop-up mini papers in class, but they can be in point form and the questions are straightforward and easy. The exams are also really straightforward and easy and it is half multiple choice and half writing. The writing part is to write abt 2 definitions and 1 topic, and they are easy to write about.

Nick was an amazing professor and the semester was great until the final. After starting fairly late, there were multiple grammar errors and other random errors in the final which made the multiple-choice questions confusing. Considering the final was worth 40% it would have been nice for it to have been read over beforehand

He was my fav prof for the semester. He provides lecture slides, notes, and recordings so technically attendance isn't mandatory but their are pop quizzes in some classes. But this class is interesting and he has a good personality which makes you want to go to class anyways. haven't done the final yet but midterm was good.
I really enjoyed his lecturing style. He really knew what he was talking about. I learned a lot in his class and he seemed like a nice guy too.

This guy is super friendly and his lectures are engaging. Participation doesn't matter, but every few classes an in-class mini-paper is assigned that counts for marks. Mastering Geography online homework is also simple and easy to understand. Would definitely take this class again if I could!

Blomley is straightforward with exams and is an amazing lecturer. He covers really interesting topics and is super approachable. Mastering Geography textbook homework is very simple each week. There were video quizzes as well which were easy to complete. His exams are mostly based off his lectures, he provided recordings and posted his slides!

NOT A HUGE FAN OF GEOG BUT THIS HAS TO BE ONE OF MY FAV PROFS! Super sweet, easy grader, easy miterm/final exams. The textbook was useless cause he straight up said he would only be testing off his lecture notes for both the midterm/final. Engaging lectures and genuinely cares about his students. 10/10 would recommend :)

he is a decent teacher, his accent plays a big role. just has a LOT of reading and self teaching straight from the textbook which SUCKS but I don't think that making the class hard is his intention... but yeah, study study study and read read read and study read read study and you should be able to just pass :) good luck!!

Nick is a good prof, and I enjoyed the course. He does a really good job of explaining concepts and keeping course material interesting. The Midterm and Final were tougher than I thought they would be, and if you want a good grade, you have to study. I wouldn't say this is a GPA booster, but if you put in the work, you should have no problems.
He is a good professor. His lecture is organized. However, his course contains many contents which require you to study hard after class. Anyone who wants to get A must study hard

Awesome Prof. Although content was dry, he tried to make the most of it by including real world examples. Tests based on lectures, so make sure you attend class or at least listen to online recordings. Great guy, and you can easily tell that he loves what he teaches.

His lectures are a little dry because the material is dry but he makes jokes to try and  make the material more interesting. Uses a lot of real world examples and exams are fair questions. Reading is heavy he wants you to read the entire chapters not just a certain pages within the chapter.

Interesting topics, but with a lot of reading required. Lectures quite theoretical but if you do the reading and try to engage with the material, you will find it more clear. Nick is very intelligible, fair marker, and a nice guy. There are 3 "mini-papers", 1 short paper and a book review (due very last day). Make sure you keep up with the reading.

Nick's conceptualizing of and research on space, place and power is impressive to say the least. He is so insightful, to not only the spatial concepts but regarding society, ethics, values, conflicting interests and the politics of it all. He is an excellent orator- one of the best profs/lecturers I have had in 6 years of studying. Sexy accent too.
Nick's class was really interesting and incorporated things that you learn in the required classes.  Very passionate about his work.  I highly recommed this teacher.
An excellent prof. Lectures are informative and well delivered. He is an expert in his field. I really enjoyed the course material. No midterm and the final is open book.
enthusiastic and interesting. good feedback too
Interesting class, fair marker, final was open book, teachcer was kind and helpful!
EXCELLENT teacher! Loved everything about him and his teaching style! I actually loved attending lecture because it was so interesting. very fair marker, fair amount of work expected.
Loved this course! His teaching style is so passionate! Very clear and organized.  Class was a lot more interesting then I thought would be!
This course is a lot of talk with little meaning...
Ah, can't remember anything standing out about his teaching style... sorry
very clear and organized, class was more interesting than it sounded
love the class; love the accent, too
No Comments
